field_benefit_categories.title: VA benefits for service members

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: VA benefits for service members | Veterans Affairs

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: If you’re serving on active duty in the United States uniformed services, including active National Guard and Reserve with federal pay, you may be eligible for VA benefits both during service and after separation or retirement. If you’re a traditional or technical member of the National Guard and Reserve, you may also be eligible for some VA benefits. Find out which benefits you may qualify for—and when to apply. You’ll also learn about these benefits in your required Transition Assistance Program (TAP) briefing.
VA benefits for service members | Veterans Affairs

If you’re serving on active duty in the United States uniformed services, including active National Guard and Reserve with federal pay, you may be eligible for VA benefits both during service and after separation or retirement. If you’re a traditional or technical member of the National Guard and Reserve, you may also be eligible for some VA benefits. Find out which benefits you may qualify for—and when to apply. You’ll also learn about these benefits in your required Transition Assistance Program (TAP) briefing.

attributes.name: twitter:description
attributes.content: Active-duty and transitioning service members may be eligible for VA benefits such as the GI Bill, career counseling, VA-backed home loans, and more. Learn more and apply for benefits.

attributes.name: twitter:title
attributes.content: VA benefits for service members | Veterans Affairs

field_benefit_categories.field_description: Active-duty and transitioning service members may be eligible for VA benefits such as the GI Bill, career counseling, VA-backed home loans, and more. Learn more and apply for benefits.
field_benefit_categories.field_intro_text: If you’re serving on active duty in the United States uniformed services, including active National Guard and Reserve with federal pay, you may be eligible for VA benefits both during service and after separation or retirement. If you’re a traditional or technical member of the National Guard and Reserve, you may also be eligible for some VA benefits. Find out which benefits you may qualify for—and when to apply. You’ll also learn about these benefits in your required Transition Assistance Program (TAP) briefing.
field_benefit_categories.field_teaser_text: Find out what benefits you may be eligible for during service and which time-sensitive benefits to consider when separating or retiring.

meta.about: Usage and meaning of the 'missing' resource identifier.

field_wysiwyg.value:
If you need support for a specific mental health problem—or if you’re having problems sleeping, controlling your anger, or readjusting to civilian life—you are not alone. And we can help.

To access free VA mental health services right away:

  • Call or walk in to any VA medical center—anytime, day or night.
    Find your nearest VA health facility
  • Call or walk in to any Vet Center during clinic hours.
    Find your nearest Vet Center
  • Call us at 877-222-8387. We’re here Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. ET. If you have hearing loss, call TTY: 800-877-8339.

You don’t need to be enrolled in VA health care to get care.
Learn more about accessing VA mental health services

To connect with other resources for Veterans and transitioning service members:

  • Visit the Department of Defense (DoD) Military OneSource website
  • Visit our mental health site for transitioning service members

  • Call or walk in to any Vet Center during clinic hours.

  • Call us at 877-222-8387. We’re here Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. ET. If you have hearing loss, call TTY: 800-877-8339.

You don’t need to be enrolled in VA health care to get care.
Learn more about accessing VA mental health services

To connect with other resources for Veterans and transitioning service members:

  • Visit the Department of Defense (DoD) Military OneSource website
  • Visit our mental health site for transitioning service members

Discover the voices of veterans through stories that speak to service, sacrifice, and resilience.

attributes.name: twitter:description
attributes.content: Discover the voices of veterans through stories that speak to service, sacrifice, and resilience.

attributes.name: twitter:title
attributes.content: Public Reading: Brothers and Sisters Like These | VA Asheville health care | Veterans Affairs

field_body.value:
Western Carolina University will host Brothers and Sisters Like These, a program featuring veterans reading their original work. The event will include a public reading followed by a question-and-answer session with the participating veterans.

This program highlights veterans’ personal experiences and perspectives through their writing. The event is open to the public.
field_body.processed:
Western Carolina University will host Brothers and Sisters Like These, a program featuring veterans reading their original work. The event will include a public reading followed by a question-and-answer session with the participating veterans.

This program highlights veterans’ personal experiences and perspectives through their writing. The event is open to the public.

field_listing.field_description: Explore upcoming Veterans outreach and engagement events in Western North Carolina. Connect with local resources, support services, and community gatherings—plan your visit today!
field_listing.field_intro_text:
The Western North Carolina VA Health Care System is committed to delivering compassionate, high-quality care to Veterans and their families. Here you will find information about upcoming events in Western North Carolina for Veterans, their Families and Caregivers.

 These events connect you with important resources, support, and community partners.

Disclaimer: Event details are subject to change. Please check this page regularly for the latest updates. Event listings and website links are provided for informational purposes only and do not imply endorsement.

field_clp_events_references.title: Great American Smokeout & Lung Cancer Screening Day 2025

breadcrumbs.title: Great American Smokeout & Lung Cancer Screening Day 2025

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: Great American Smokeout & Lung Cancer Screening Day 2025 | VA Boston health care | Veterans Affairs
Great American Smokeout & Lung Cancer Screening Day 2025 | VA Boston health care | Veterans Affairs
Great American Smokeout is Nov. 20! VA Boston will have tables at our man campuses & CBOCs, 8am-12pm, to help Veterans quit tobacco. Call 855-784-8838

attributes.name: twitter:title
attributes.content: Great American Smokeout & Lung Cancer Screening Day 2025 | VA Boston health care | Veterans Affairs

attributes.name: twitter:image:alt
attributes.content: Great American Smokeout is Nov. 20! VA Boston will have tables at our man campuses & CBOCs, 8am-12pm, to help Veterans quit tobacco. Call 855-784-8838

field_body.value:
The Great American Smokeout & Lung Cancer Screening Day is Nov. 20, 2025!

VA Boston Healthcare system will have resource tables at our three main campuses – Brockton, Jamaica Plain, and West Roxbury – and our community outpatient clinics, 8:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. on Thursday, Nov. 20, to help connect Veterans and employees with tobacco treatment services at VA Boston. 

We're encouraging Veterans to learn how to Quit Like a Pro. Here are three pro tips: 

  1. Explore all VA tobacco treatments available to you, including prescription medications, nicotine replacement therapies, and counseling;
  2. Use medication and counseling together — real-life results show that this gives you the best chance of stopping for good; and
  3. Understand that, as with any skill, every attempt you make to stop teaches you something that can help you quit later. 

Veterans can talk with their VA health care team or call 1-855-QUIT-VET (1-855-784-8838) to get started today.

We're combining the Great American Smokeout with Lung Cancer Screening Awareness Day, to promote enrollment in Lung Cancer Screening for eligible Veterans. Early detection saves lives!
field_body.processed:
The Great American Smokeout & Lung Cancer Screening Day is Nov. 20, 2025!

VA Boston Healthcare system will have resource tables at our three main campuses – Brockton, Jamaica Plain, and West Roxbury – and our community outpatient clinics, 8:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. on Thursday, Nov. 20, to help connect Veterans and employees with tobacco treatment services at VA Boston. 

We're encouraging Veterans to learn how to Quit Like a Pro. Here are three pro tips: 

  1. Explore all VA tobacco treatments available to you, including prescription medications, nicotine replacement therapies, and counseling;
  2. Use medication and counseling together — real-life results show that this gives you the best chance of stopping for good; and
  3. Understand that, as with any skill, every attempt you make to stop teaches you something that can help you quit later. 

Veterans can talk with their VA health care team or call 1-855-QUIT-VET (1-855-784-8838) to get started today.

We're combining the Great American Smokeout with Lung Cancer Screening Awareness Day, to promote enrollment in Lung Cancer Screening for eligible Veterans. Early detection saves lives!

field_facility_location.field_description: Get address and hours, parking and transportation information, and health services offered at Jamaica Plain VA Medical Center
field_facility_location.field_intro_text: The Jamaica Plain campus of the VA Boston HCS provides primary care and specialty services, including mental health, laser therapy for vision and cancer, and treatment for spinal cord injuries. The Ambulatory Care Center serves as a hub for outpatient care, including Audiology, Ambulatory Day Surgery, Diagnostic Imagery and aphasia treatment. Services also include substance abuse programs, neuropsychology and the only VA radiation oncology program in the region. This campus is also home to the Behavioral Science and Women’s Health Sciences Divisions of the National Center for PTSD.

field_clp_faq_paragraphs.field_question: How can I attend an event?

field_wysiwyg.value: Join an event for conversation, resources, and information about VA health care and benefits. FInd an event near you.
field_wysiwyg.processed: Join an event for conversation, resources, and information about VA health care and benefits. FInd an event near you.

field_clp_faq_paragraphs.field_question: I have a question for your team. How can I contact you?

field_wysiwyg.value: Send us an email at ActionCenter@va.gov. You can also sign up for the VetResources Newsletter and get connected with your local VA facility to stay current on information and events in your community.
field_wysiwyg.processed: Send us an email at ActionCenter@va.gov. You can also sign up for the VetResources Newsletter and get connected with your local VA facility to stay current on information and events in your community.

field_clp_faq_paragraphs.field_question: How do VA 1on-1: Veteran Assistance Expo events work?

field_wysiwyg.value: VA 1-on-1: Veteran Assistance Expo events are collaborative efforts that include representation from Veterans Health Administration, Veterans Benefits Administration, National Cemetery Administration, Board of Veterans’ Appeals, state departments of Veterans Affairs, and community partners working together to offer one-on-one personalized assistance for VA benefits and health care, crisis support, memorial affairs, community services, and peer-to-peer connections.
field_wysiwyg.processed: VA 1-on-1: Veteran Assistance Expo events are collaborative efforts that include representation from Veterans Health Administration, Veterans Benefits Administration, National Cemetery Administration, Board of Veterans’ Appeals, state departments of Veterans Affairs, and community partners working together to offer one-on-one personalized assistance for VA benefits and health care, crisis support, memorial affairs, community services, and peer-to-peer connections.

field_q_as.title: What’s the 6-digit security code that ID.me is asking me for?

breadcrumbs.title: What’s The 6-digit Security Code That ID.me Is Asking Me For?

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: What’s the 6-digit security code that ID.me is asking me for? | Veterans Affairs
What’s the 6-digit security code that ID.me is asking me for? | Veterans Affairs

attributes.name: twitter:title
attributes.content: What’s the 6-digit security code that ID.me is asking me for? | Veterans Affairs

field_wysiwyg.value:
This code is part of the multifactor authentication process.

When you set up a verified VA.gov account through ID.me, you need to set up multifactor authentication. Authentication gives you an extra layer of security by letting you into your account only after you’ve signed in with a password and a 6-digit code sent directly to your mobile or home phone. This helps to make sure that no one but you can access your account—even if they get your password.
field_wysiwyg.processed:
This code is part of the multifactor authentication process.

When you set up a verified VA.gov account through ID.me, you need to set up multifactor authentication. Authentication gives you an extra layer of security by letting you into your account only after you’ve signed in with a password and a 6-digit code sent directly to your mobile or home phone. This helps to make sure that no one but you can access your account—even if they get your password.
